website_summaries.verdict: While it's manufactured in Germany, its core is created from Chinese culinary greatness including a 2-millimeter blade.
pros: One of the sharpest blades of its kind and loved by those who prefer to be in the kitchen more than anywhere else
A thoughtful gift, this stainless steel knife is not only shiny but achieves consistent slices in most things you cut
cons: One of the most common complaints is that the knife is too big for a block

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife, but be careful with the sharp edge
customer_reviews.text: The knife is really sharp, I like it. However the back of the blade has sharp edges. When I cut hard veggitables such as pumpkin, I need to press the back of the blade down to make it easier to cut, the sharp edge makes my finger bleed. Just like a paper cut, it's not serious, but annoying. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: disappointing ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: In spite of the shape of the handle, using this cleaver to cut tough vegetables such as rutabagas, large carrots, cabbages, etc. is hard on the hands. I grip the cleaver using the first finger and thumb to grip the top of the blade and I hold the handle in the other fingers. The handle should be thicker given the force necessary to cut through root vegetables. The edge is excellent, a steep angle, and the blade is a good weight.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Zwilling J.A. knife, and it is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Zwilling chef knife around 3 years ago when I used to be a sushi chef. It was very nice and efficient to cut countless sushi rolls. As I started to cook at home more, I decided to buy this same brand cleaver. It did not disappoint me. It is sharp and durable. Good to be used for various cooking skills. I am very satisfied with this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Johny

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stir Frys!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding for the price point! It was fairly sharp out of the box, but was improved with a hone to an extremely fine edge. There is a little more rocker to the edge than most Chinese Cleavers, which have a straight edge. Personally, I prefer the rounded edges, because it allows the knife to be rocked on the board similar to a Chef’s Knife. Great for all veggies and boneless meats!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ralph

customer_reviews.title: it works great!! It says it's for veggies
customer_reviews.text: I only use henckel knives at home and usually I would just buy them at William Sonoma. This was the first time buying one online and I have to say, it works great!! It says it's for veggies, but I tried with meat "just to see". It works great for both!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Kim

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Vegatable Cleaver
customer_reviews.text: This knife is very high quality and well designed for rapid precision vegetable prep. It is sharp enough to produce paper think shavings from hard vegetable. Pay attention to what you're dong when using this knife as it is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Opie

customer_reviews.title: Get to the choppahh!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Chinese cleavers and this is, IMHO, a good one. Very sharp, nice balance, and easy to scoop up what you cut!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Chop Chop!
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy this for my 19 piece set. The block had the slot, but not the knife. I love this chopper. Heavy duty construction. The knives go dull fairly quickly, so I recommend sharpening before each use.

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a cleaver!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is arguably one of the best you can buy for chopping/dicing veggies. Heavy enough for just about any veg prepping you need to do, yet very well balanced and easy to use. I warned my wife to be careful of the edge when we first got it, and she still managed to knick herself. The blade is very sharp, which of course makes it a pleasure to use. Will definitely buy another when/if this one can no longer hold an edge...which I don't see happening for several years. If you chop, slice or dice a lot of veggies, you'll love this knife!

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for opening young thai coconuts
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this knife for about 6 months now and used it innumerable times to open young thai coconuts. That's one of the heaviest duty tasks in the veggie world and the knife held up very well. The blade is riveted to the handle solidly and is sturdy - just right to open the coconut like a "pop top" without the risk of the blade bending. Quite happy with my purchase and highly recommend it for such purposes. **Updated review in 2020** This knife is still going strong in my kitchen! _/|\_

product_meta.title: Zwilling J.A. Henckels TWIN Signature Chinese Chef's Knife/Vegetable Cleaver, 7", Black/Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
Twin signature knives are precision stamped from a single piece of German steel, resulting in lighter weight knives that do not compromise sharpness. The knives are made of proprietary special formula steel that has been perfected for over 280 years. Combined with zwilling's signature ice-hardening technique, these friodur blades are harder, sharper, they will not stain or chip and they retain their sharpness longer.to ensure an ideal cutting angle, the laser-controlled edge is incredibly sharp and is honed and hand-finished by the most skilled artisans. The three-rivet handle embedded with the ZWILLING J.A. Henckels logo provides optimum durability.

AMAZON.COM
With their laser-controlled edges and durable blades, Henckels Twin Signature knives deliver quality and precision without maxing out the budget. Twin Signature knives feature high-carbon stainless-steel blades that have been stamped from a single piece of metal and put through the patented Friodur ice-hardening process to ensure their strength. The edges are laser-controlled for consistency and sharpness, and each one is hand-honed during the production process. The polymer handles are ergonomically designed and offer a comfortable fit for mid-size or smaller hands. Three stainless-steel rivets secure the handle to the blade, and the full-tang construction (the stamped steel piece that runs the full length of the knife) ensures better handling and durability. Perfect for chopping and dicing meat, fish, and vegetables, this 7-inch cleaver is especially useful for diagonal cuts and stir-fry, though it is not designed to break bones. Made in Germany, the knife is safe in the dishwasher, though Henckels recommends washing it by hand. --Emily Bedard
feature_bullets: Special formula high carbon no stain steel
One piece precision stamped blade for a lighter weight knife without sacrificing strength
Ice hardened Friodur blade starts sharper stays sharper longer and has superior resilience
Ergonomic polymer handle is perfectly bonded to full tang
Traditional three rivet design is embedded with Zwilling J.A; Henckels logo
